data.title: Unique salads
data.text: Unique choices. Stopped by for lunch. Salads were excellent with great combinations of ingredients. Service very good.

data.title: Delious lunch!
data.text: Our party of three stopped in today (Sunday) after shopping at the Farmer's Market.   The restaurant was busy,  with much energetic and lively conversation at the tables.   We were greeted very promptly and our drinks arrived shortly after placing the order.   The kitchen was at the top of their game today.   The food came out in record time-just a few minutes after we ordered.  My Turkey Mango wrap was out-of-this-world!  What an amazing, flavorful sandwich.   My companions both ordered the Tuscan Chicken wrap and again it was delious.   We all loved the macaroni salad (and were told that Craisins are one of the not-so-secret ingredients.)  Portions were generous (we all left feeling satisfied)  and price very reasonable.  The seating at the hi-top table was comfortable  and the decor was pleasant.   We had a extremely enjoyable lunch and will be sure to return.

data.title: Good food, polite staff
data.text: Went there on a whim, as a treat for myself while doing errands.  For slightly more than the price of a fast food "value meal" I received a tasty pannini and wonderful macaroni salad, along with a gourmet soda. The salad had cranberries in it and was very tasty. The pannini was turkey, brie and cranberry aioli. The service was speedy and polite, with added bonus of 10% off for paying in cash.  It was so good, I went back again the next week.

data.title: Lunch was GREAT,dinner was WONDERFUL!!!!
data.text:
The decor was laid back and comfortable.The service was very good and the food
was awesome!!I had the BEST braised short ribs I ever tasted!!!!My wife had one of
the specials,penne pasta w/creamed shrimp sauce and our guest had the short ribs
which by the way,fell off the bone!Salad was served family style with walnuts,cranberries
and blue cheese crumbles,Delicious!The wine was a excellant montepulchiano and
for desert,homemade lemon chiffon cake and HOT coffee.WONDERFUL!

data.title: Consistently excellent!! Don't miss out on eating at this hidden Gem!!
data.text: We have been here 3 times for dinner.  This is a charming little bistro, with a friendly atmosphere and fantastic consistently wonderful food!!!! The staff always makes you feel welcome.   Great wines, We like the Spanish red.  All the meals are fresh prepared and filled with exhilarating flavor.  The clams and or shrimp are plump and fresh. The meat dishes are cooked perfectly.  The sauces Pop with mouth watering flavor! The Parmesan Pollenta is so special, then... Their house salad... IS TO WANT MORE !!!!!... Then there are fantastic apps, like the french onion spread.  The staff are so friendly, they add some fun to your experience.  The Italian wedding cake for desert...Oh BOY!!!  Great for the whole family.  We have never had lunch there but, we want to.  Don't miss this great Bistro, bring your friends for dinner!!

data.title: Hate to be picky, BUT...
data.text: Lunch with three friends - and our first time here.  I ordered a bowl of white clam chowder, which was very, very thick - too thick actually -  with lots of clams and potatoes and good flavor.  Too heavy for my taste.  I didn't finish it.  Two pieces of bread, on the side, but no butter.  There was no salt nor pepper on the table.  We all had water, but our server never asked if we wanted any other drinks.  I tasted my friends macaroni salad - very odd.  They didn't like it either.  One more downside - the noise level is very high when other diners are there, as there is nothing to absorb the sound.  Even tho the decor is nice - it's  totally bare - and echoes.  Sorry, Bel Cibo.

owner_response.author: Jeanette M, Owner at Bel Cibo Fine Gourmet Foods and Spices, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm very sorry to hear you didn't enjoy your lunch experience, sadly the things you disliked were the things most people love. For example, our pasta salad is one of our most popular items, people by it buy the quart all week, when we switch it up to potato salad for example, we get guff.  I'm unsure if you're aware, but we suffered a major fire last year, and due to that, we are still on the mend, so the restaurant isn't as complete as we would like, but again, our customers know that and understand. We've come a very long way in the ten months since we were closed, but still have a long way to go, but we are again, are working on it. Sad but true, we can't please everyone, as much as I'd like to, but thankfully your one star is in a sea of five stars, and our reviews by local reviewers are consistently on point., and have brought people in time and time again. I hope that someday you give us another try, and please if your displeased with something, speak up, we can't correct an issue if we don't know there is one. P.S. We don't keep the shakers on the table because they are consistently stolen 😊, just ask next time we will bring them to you, a very simple solution.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Where to eat in Schenectady? Bel Cibo!
data.text: A real gem of a restaurant in Schenectady's city hall district. Do yourself a favor and try the Shrimp and Polenta dish. You won't be sorry. This chef is outstanding and the proprietor Jeanette is a delight. K.Thornton

owner_response.author: Jeanette M, Owner at Bel Cibo Fine Gourmet Foods and Spices, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you! It means so much.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Tasty Lunch with Fresh Ingredients
data.text: We sat by the window which gave us a commanding view of Schenectady's center hub- City Hall, Jay Street and the Post Office. My flat bread was huge, tasty and made with fresh ingredients. My sister's grilled cheese looked yummy also and her side order of potato salad was made with baby red potatoes. I know what to order next time. We started with the soup of the day- a spicy red tomato bisque with shredded beef and chopped veggies. Not your typical soup. It was more like a chili. So good. The portions were generous. The bill was a little high for 2 people for lunch but everything was delicious and worth the money to the very last bite of chocolate cupcake. We will come for dinner sometime and lunch again. One other thing- no one told us about the specials. We over heard it told to another table later on. I probably would have had the artichoke panini special if I knew about it. That's okay because I enjoyed what I ordered very much. All the staff was very friendly.

owner_response.author: Jeanette M, Owner at Bel Cibo Fine Gourmet Foods and Spices, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, we are always trying to improve!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful time
data.text: Our time at Bel Cibo was wonderful. The service was great and the staff treated us so friendly . The food was plenty, fresh and delicious. We know where we will dine again.

owner_response.author: Jeanette M, Owner at Bel Cibo Fine Gourmet Foods and Spices, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, we loved having you for your special day!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: I stopped in while visiting farmers market. Picked up a Turkey Mangoe Wrap to go. Delicious, friendly staff. Looking forward to trying dinner!

owner_response.author: Jeanette M, Owner at Bel Cibo Fine Gourmet Foods and Spices, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, for your review, it means more than you know!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Lunch EVER!!!
data.text: What a great place to have a great lunch! Good food ! Good service! Everything homemade and fresh! Will go back over and over!

owner_response.author: Jeanette M, Owner at Bel Cibo Fine Gourmet Foods and Spices, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review and kind words!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great pre-show meal!!!!!
data.text: Service was excellent! We had a plentiful charcuterie platter, house salad (WONDERFUL!) and entrees of steak, and shrimp over polenta. It was all great!

data.title: Sidewalk dining, reasonably priced, YUM!
data.text: Fabulous attentive service on a weekday evening - most patrons were headed to nearby Proctors Theater and looked happy they'd made Bel Cibo their choice. I sat at a small outdoor table on a glorious evening, in view of the sun setting over the beautiful City Hall architecture. Was given great attention, recommendations for treats, and thrilled by a garlicky linguini with shrimp, yummy mushrooms, just enough spinach and delish soft dried tomatoes. GREAT cupcake selection, wines too. A delightful May evening with a great book and friendly staff and patrons. What more could a girl ask for?

data.title: visit to Bel Cibo
data.text: This is a great place and re opened over a month ago. Great location and parking really close too. Jeanette is wonderful also.

data.title: Great menu specials.
data.text: Reminds me of an Italian Deli.  Service was good and the food was excellent.  They have daily specials that change continually.

data.title: Wonderful service with absolutely phenomenal food
data.text: The location is quiet and the food is unbelievably delicious. Paninis and flatbreads are soooo good and the salads are delicious and  HUGE.  In addition to the yummy food,the owner Jeanette is always so kind to everyone that comes in.  She will check on your table and is always so sweet.  She is one of the many reasons we come back.  The wait staff is attentive.  One of my favorite places to grab lunch in downtown Schenectady!

data.title: Ate there twice in one day
data.text: We ended up driving quite a bit out of our way to have lunch at Bel Cibo, because we realized that they had finally re-opened after the fire.  And while we were having lunch, we saw the planned menu for that evening- it was restaurant week in Schenectady, and decided to come back for dinner.  The owners and staff were a lot of fun, and our meals- both for lunch and dinner- were great.  The restaurant will begin dinner service in reality as of mid-march, 2016.  They took advantage of the restaurant week and opened for dinner for that special event a bit early.  We can definitely recommend the cheese board appetizer, and the french onion soup crostini.  The chicken piccata was delicious, as was the stuffed portobello.

owner_response.author: Jeanette M, Owner at Bel Cibo Fine Gourmet Foods and Spices, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We enjoyed your company and look forward to seeing you again! Thanks for the review, it is greatly appreciated!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
